items.title: Merging Two Software Worlds
items.subtitle: Test Lead · Seeder (EU code + US UI)
items.excerpt: Owned testing and stabilization after merging EU codebase with US UI under a tight schedule.
items.body: As Test Lead, I handled testing of two regional variants (EU/US). After merging EU code with the US UI, core flows broke. I established short, agile test cycles with clear priorities and rapid feedback to dev. Result: a stable, shippable release that combined the strengths of both systems.

items.title: Structured Testing & Requirements
items.subtitle: Zephyr in Jira · Polarion · Team enablement
items.excerpt: Introduced Zephyr (test authoring, execution, documentation) and moved requirements to Polarion.
items.body: Together with two colleagues, I introduced Zephyr in Jira: proper test artifacts, traceable execution, documented results, direct bugfix loops. In parallel, I drove Polarion adoption for requirements—replacing unstructured Confluence pages with versioned, traceable specs.

items.title: SIM Card Surfer (Telecom)
items.subtitle: Solo project · Embedded · TENOL · TCP/IP
items.excerpt: Embedded solution for remote SIM usage; data transport and real-time auth without exporting keys.
items.body: Built a SIM Surfer handling up to 30 SIMs in emerging markets. Read via TENOL, streamed over TCP/IP to a client (e.g., London). Keys were never exported; authentication ran in real time between endpoints. Outcome: reliable cross-border virtual SIM usage.

items.title: My First Touchpoint with Testing
items.subtitle: Telekom · Clipper · DBASE · DOS
items.excerpt: Support and pre-release testing for a nationwide dispatch system—my QA starting point.
items.body: Within a central working group (FTZ Darmstadt), I owned support, hotline, and pre-release tests for a dispatch system (Clipper on DOS, DBASE). This shaped my early understanding of structured QA and release quality.

items.title: Technical Look Behind the Scenes
items.subtitle: JavaScript · JSON · Bilingual
items.excerpt: Site is rendered in JavaScript; content is JSON-driven; bilingual UI updates dynamically.
items.body: The entire portfolio is rendered via JavaScript. Content (navigation, skills, CV, stories) is loaded from JSON, cleanly separating content/logic/presentation. Bilingual (DE/EN) texts are updated dynamically via applyTexts(); the static HTML remains minimal.
